messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] PEAH
messages.msgSnippet: PEAH will provide a free access number for Joann for any homeschooler via this form: http://www.peah.com/joann.php and here s the page to apply for the
messages.messageBody:
PEAH will provide a free access number for Joann for any homeschooler
via this form:

http://www.peah.com/joann.php

and here's the page to apply for the discount, for anyone who needs the
addy:

http://about-joann-stores.joann.com/education/teachers.php

I used it, no difficulties. I'll let you know if there are any problems
getting my card.

--
Phoebe, mama to:
Faith, Abby, Bede, Gil and ? due 2-06
http://phoebe.gleeson.us

"You did what you knew how to do, and when you knew better, you did better." ~Maya Angelou
QUESTION CIRCUMCISION!
http://oknocirc.blogspot.com

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] PEAH
messages.msgSnippet: Yes. Our local group complained loudly about this.  In Michigan you do not have to go through PEAH to get a JoAnn s discount card. You can get one right at
messages.messageBody:
Yes. Our local group complained loudly about this. In Michigan you do not
have to go through PEAH to get a JoAnn's discount card. You can get one
right at your local store. Not sure if that is just Michigan or if it
applies everywhere.



~April
Mom to Kate-19, Lisa-16, Karl-14, & Ben-10.
*REACH Homeschool Grp, an inclusive group in Oakland County
<http://www.reachhomeschool.com> www.reachhomeschool.com

* Michigan Unschoolers
<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/>
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/
*Check out Chuck's art! <http://www.artkunst23.com/>
http://www.artkunst23.com
*Michigan Youth Theater...Acting On Our Dreams...
<http://www.michiganyouththeater.com/> http://www.michiganyouththeater.com
"Know where to find the information and how to use it - That's the secret of
success."
Albert Einstein (1879-1955)

_____

From: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com [mailto:AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com]
On Behalf Of backstagemomma
Sent: Thursday, September 29, 2005 9:30 AM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] PEAH



Anybody know about the PEAH card? I was looking at the Joann's
discount card and they are now requiring you to be a PEAH (Parents
Education at Home) member. You can get a Joann's access code for free,
but to really be a member it costs $19/year (on special). Meanwhile,
it looks like their online directory of other businesses is not yet up
and running, although they claim there are 150+ of them. Are there any
other businesses requiring this membership? Has anyone had any
experience with it? Check it out: www.PEAH.com
Gretchen







_____

discount card and they are now requiring you to be a PEAH (Parents

but to really be a member it costs $19/year (on special). Meanwhile,

and running, although they claim there are 150+ of them. Are there any
